abstract.t: This document updates RFC8203 by defining an Extended BGP Administrative Shutdown Communication to improve communication using multibyte character sets.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The Administrative Shutdown Communication is a simple mechanism to transit a short freeform UTF-8 message as part of a Cease NOTIFICATION message to inform the peer why the BGP session is being shutdown or reset.

Feedback from operators based in regions which predominantly use multibyte character sets, showed that messages similar in meaning to what can be send in other languages in using single-byte encoding failed to fit within the Length constraints as specified by . For example, the phrase: 'Planned works to adding switch to stack. Completion time - 30 minutes' has length 69 bytes. Its translation in Russian 'Плановые работы по добавлению коммутатора в стек. Время завершения - 30 минут' has length 139 bytes.
This document extends the length of the Administrative Shutdown Communication to 255 octets.

section.title: Changes to RFC 8203
section.t: This section updates to specify the maximum length of an Administrative Shutdown Communication.
The following paragraph replaces the Length definition in Section 2 (Shutdown Communication):

list.t: this 8-bit field represents the length of the Shutdown Communication field in octets. When the length value is zero, no Shutdown Communication field follows.

section.t: The following paragraph replaces the second paragraph of Section 5 (Security Considerations):

list.t: As BGP Shutdown Communications are likely to appear in syslog output, there is a risk that carefully constructed Shutdown Communication might be formatted by receiving systems in a way to make them appear as additional syslog messages. To limit the ability to mount such an attack, the BGP Shutdown Communication is limited to 255 octets in length.
